SEARCH
Module paths
Package ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt2001.ejhaslerjorgfi.model.Game
public class Game extends Object

Game

Definition

Acts as a facade for the path-game which the application represents. It can connect a Player to a given Story, and provide a set of Goals which a Player can achieve throughout the Game.

Functionality

The Game class represents an interface for running the game which the application is meant for. It provides methods for starting and maneouver throughout the Game. The Game class accepts a Player which are to be used, and a Story which the Player will experience.

Attributes

The Game class will contain a Player which are to act in the Story. The Player is stored in the player field.

A Game instance connects its given Player to a certain Story which the Player will experience. The Story is accepted as a parameter in the constructor of the Game class, and stored in story.

Each Game object may hold a collection of Goal objects. The Goals represents achievements which a Player can accquire in the Story. All possible Goals is stored as a List in the goals field.

Since:
12.02.2023
Version:
27.02.2023
Author:
Group 24

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Player player, Story story, List<Goal> goals)
      Creates a new instance of the Game class with a given Player, Story and a collection of Goal objects.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player which will be in the Game.
      story - the Story which the Game will follow.
      goals - collection of Goals which a Player can achieve in the Game.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either Player, Story, or the collection of Goal instances is null or empty.

    • go

      public Passage go(Link link)
      Moves to a different Passage object in the Story by accessing the Link object connecting the current Passage with another one.
      Parameters:
      link - The Link object which connects to another Passage.
      Returns:
      The Passage object which the given Link is associated to.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the Link object is null.
